triples.name: Time-dependent differential equations
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a time-dependent SIR model that tracks transmission and recovery rates as time-varying functions, novel extension of traditional SIR models.

triples.name: Compartmental models in epidemiology
triples.relevance: The SIR model is a compartmental model that the paper extends with time-dependent parameters and undetectable infected persons.

triples.name: COVID-19
triples.relevance: The disease that the paper analyzes and models for prediction and outbreak characterization.

triples.name: Spectral radius
triples.relevance: Mathematical concept used to characterize whether an outbreak occurs based on a matrix property threshold.

triples.name: Information cascade
triples.relevance: The independent cascade model for disease propagation in networks is analyzed to assess social distancing effectiveness.

triples.name: Basic reproduction number
triples.relevance: The effective reproduction number is analyzed as a key epidemiological measure for assessing disease transmission.

triples.name: Social distancing
triples.relevance: Public health intervention strategy that the paper analyzes for its effectiveness in reducing transmission.

triples.name: Configuration model
triples.relevance: Random network model used as the structure for analyzing disease propagation through independent cascade dynamics.
